Line 238: Line 238:
On April 23, 2011, the New York-based TV station [[NY1]] reported that Trump had not voted in primary elections in New York City for a span of 21 years,<ref>[http://www.ny1.com/content/137902/donald-trump-s-primary-voting-record-spotty--records-show NY1.com]</ref> beginning after the city's mayoral primary in 1989, an accusation he has denied. A City election board spokeswoman confirmed the story.<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/apr/24/donald-trump-election-voting-record Guardian.co.uk]</ref>
On April 23, 2011, the New York-based TV station [[NY1]] reported that Trump had not voted in primary elections in New York City for a span of 21 years,<ref>[http://www.ny1.com/content/137902/donald-trump-s-primary-voting-record-spotty--records-show NY1.com]</ref> beginning after the city's mayoral primary in 1989, an accusation he has denied. A City election board spokeswoman confirmed the story.<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/apr/24/donald-trump-election-voting-record Guardian.co.uk]</ref>
  +   +
On Apr 27, Trump held a press conference expressing pride at his role in the release of the long-form of Obama's birth certificate. At the press conference, Trump implied that Obama had not truly earned admission to Harvard Law. Bob Scheifer, head of CBS News Washington, took the unusual step of characterizing the presumed candidate's comments as implicitly racist.
  +   +
Trump attended the 2011 white house correspondent's dinner, where many of the jokes referenced Trump. Trump stated in his own estimation the he was the primary focus of the presentation.
===Statements regarding Barack Obama===
===Statements regarding Barack Obama===
